New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his 47th home run of the season, setting a new personal record and tying the MLB record for most home runs by an Asian player with 218 career home runs.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a solo home run in the first inning.
Ohtani also stole his 48th base of the season.
Ohtani hit a 2-run single in the third inning.
Tommy Edman hit two home runs in the game.
Gavin Lux hit a go-ahead single in the eighth inning.
Michael Kopech struggled with control in the ninth inning, walking three consecutive batters.
Seiya Suzuki was caught stealing third base in the ninth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers aimed to avoid a three-game sweep against the Cubs.
Teoscar Hernandez returned to the Dodgers' starting lineup.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers' victory highlighted their offensive strength but also exposed pitching vulnerabilities, raising concerns for their World Series aspirations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles.
The Dodgers maintained their lead in the National League West with an 87-59 record.
